title: 31.9 Integer Factorization
content:
Section 31.9

Integer Factorization

Summary

Algorithms for factoring composite numbers.

Key Points

  • No known polynomial-time algorithm!
  • Pollard's rho: expected O(n^(1/4)) for smallest factor
  • Uses cycle detection (Floyd's algorithm)
  • Quadratic sieve, number field sieve for large numbers
  • RSA security relies on factoring being hard

Pseudocode

POLLARD-RHO(n):
    x = RANDOM(0, n-1)
    y = x
    d = 1
    while d == 1:
        x = (x² + 1) mod n
        y = (y² + 1) mod n
        y = (y² + 1) mod n
        d = gcd(|x - y|, n)
    return d

Example

Factor 1387: Pollard's rho finds 19 (since 1387 = 19 × 73).

Why It Matters

Breaking RSA = factoring. Quantum computers threaten this.
